sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
Suppose that \(i + k = 2j \) and also it is given that 
\[
	\frac{1}{j } + \frac{1}{l } = \frac{2}{k }
\]
Now, prove that \(i \), \(j \), \(k \), and \(l \) are in proportion.
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "It is given that 
\[
	\frac{1}{j } + \frac{1}{l } = \frac{2}{k }
\]
\[
	\frac{l + j }{\input[s1v1]{}l } = \frac{2}{k }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow kl + jk = 2j\input[s1v2]{} 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow kl + jk = (\input[s3v1]{} + \input[s3v2]{} )l 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow kl + \input[s4v1]{}k = il + kl 
	\Rightarrow j\input[s4v2]{} = il 
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{\input[s4v1]{} }{j } = \frac{\input[s4v2]{} }{l }
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{
This means that $i $, $j $, $k $, and $l $ are in proportion.

Hence proved.
\newline
}$$
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["j", "l"], "text": "$$\text{Upon taking LCM's and cross-multiplying we get $kl + jk = 2jl $}$$"}, {"data": ["i", "k"], "text": "$$\text{Since, it is given that $i + k = 2j$, replacing $2j, we get $ kl + jk = (i + k )l $}$$"}, {"data": ["j", "k"], "text": "$$\text{Upon opening up the bracket and cancelling the common terms on both sides we get $jk = il$}$$ "}, {"data": ["i", "k"], "text": "$$\text{Upon dividing both sides by $jl$, we get $\frac{i }{j } = \frac{k }{l }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
